main event: A person in Clovis, California saw a solid object that changed from green flickering to reddish sparks in the sky for 20-30 seconds in 1960.
interesting points: The object was initially observed as green flickering, then changed to reddish sparks.
The object was determined to likely be satellite debris or part of satellite motion characteristic for that time period and location.
There was no associated satellite decay detected by SPADATS (Space Detection and Tracking System) during the time of the sighting.
Another witness, an off-duty Air Force man at a traffic terminal, also reported seeing something.
The witness described the object as saucer-shaped, with an underbelly of lights, hovering at around 5,000 feet and then accelerating away at a high speed.
sighted object: A solid, saucer-shaped object with changing colors
